meanings.definition: The area or space in which sound is produced during a performance or recording.
meanings.sent1: The soundstage at the concert was filled with music and cheers.
meanings.sent2: The soundstage in the studio had microphones and instruments set up.
meanings.sent3: The soundstage seemed to shrink as the band played louder and louder.
meanings.sent4: Her voice filled the soundstage like a warm blanket on a cold night.
meanings.sent5: The soundstage echoed with the laughter of the audience.

meanings.definition: The physical or virtual environment in which sound is perceived to originate and move within.
meanings.sent1: The soundstage of the movie made it feel like the action was happening all around you.
meanings.sent2: The soundstage of the video game created an immersive experience for the players.
meanings.sent3: The soundstage of the horror movie made the audience jump in their seats.
meanings.sent4: In the soundstage of his mind, the music danced and swirled like colorful ribbons.
meanings.sent5: The soundstage of the forest was alive with chirping birds and rustling leaves.
